column4: especially ones where the quantity of high level knowledge is not required or is possible to be learned whilst working at the same time. Young people studying to be an electrician or a plumber are good examples. To do this work well requires a lot of experience
column5: yet also a sound understanding of theory. The learning here can be and is done working and studying at the same time
column6: often through apprenticeships and vocational courses involving significant amounts of work experience.

column1: Therefore
column2: in my opinion
column3: there are more ways than one to acquire a profession. Whether learning should take place at university alone or whilst working depends on the course and the end job.

People today find their lives more and more dominated by their jobs. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement?

It is certainly true that many people around the world find their lives dominated by the work that they have to do. This is shown when you realise how people's work
column2: and how much time
column3: effort and resources they devote to it
column4: is often the subject of conversation.

column1: Most people depend on their jobs to generate an income to pay for their lives' necessities and luxuries
column2: and so work can naturally become a dominating focus. As this is an important part of nearly everyone's everyday life
column3: it can seem that people's lives are indeed becoming more influenced by their jobs. Whether this emphasis on work is more significant now than in previous years is debatable. In many developed countries around the world
column4: there are procedures in place to help people with finding work
column5: providing unemployment benefits
column6: ensuring education
column7: and offering pension payments. In times past
column8: these provisions were not in place and a job or business was required to provide the necessary income.

column1: Therefore

column3: it can be argued there is actually less pressure than in previous years to keep one's job and perform well at it. This
column4: in turn
column5: would lead to people's lives being less influenced by their jobs today. It is also true that in the past
column6: people were as responsible and focused on doing well in their responsibilities as today and so
column7: in this respect

column1: While I agree that people's lives today are often dominated by their jobs
